generate_quote

 generate_quote (journal_entry:str)


quote = generate_quote("Today was a great day. I jumped in the friged waters of Ocean Beach, I pushed out some changes to this journaling app. I played games with friends and meditated.")
print(quote)

"Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." - Helen Keller

- jumped in the frigid waters of Ocean Beach
- pushed out some changes to this journaling app
- played games with friends
- meditated

title: :studio_microphone: Notion Audio Journal

pip install audio-journal
After you’ve update the ~/.audio-journal/config with your page ID and integration key
audio_journal_start

title: :studio_microphone: Notion Audio Journal
text:
pip install audio-journal
After you’ve update the ~/.audio-journal/config with your page ID and integration key
audio_journal_start

title: :studio_microphone: Notion Audio Journal
text:
Why?
I wish I journaled more often. The ability to look back through the years, reflect and remember events long past is invaluable.
While the benefits of hand written journaling are clear, forcing one to slow down, to organize one’s thoughts, I find the 5x slow down makes it a non-starter. So instead lets optimize for gross word count!

title: :studio_microphone: Notion Audio Journal
text:
Future work

Offer alternative storage options
Interface with a mic, always on, wait for wake word

recording_process

title: main
text:
This is the entry point for the application. It starts two processes 1. A recording process that will save input audio to a file 2. A transcribing process that will watch for new recordings, and transcribe and upload them if found.
